ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: New HIV treatments can be taken after unsafe sex to prevent HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: New treatments make it easier to relax about unsafe sex
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: My friends practice more unsafe sex because of new HIV treatments
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: New treatments make you worry less about HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: PEP (Post-Exposure Prophylaxis) should be made available immediately
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: HIV medication can be taken by an uninfected person to reduce the risk of getting the HIV virus
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) would make it easier to relax about sex without condoms
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: Taking HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) makes me worry less about HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: If I take HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) during my pregnancy, it would protect my baby from HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: If I take HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) after I give birth, it would protect my baby from HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown

ElementDescription: If I take HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) when I am breastfeeding, it would protect my baby from HIV infection
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree; -9= Missing/Unknown
